objects.name: PAP
objects.description: This defines PAP as a STIX extension

objects.name: Grimbolt Espionage
objects.description: A suspected PRC-nexus group exploiting critical zero-days in virtualization software to deploy novel backdoors like GRIMBOLT and BRICKSTORM.

objects.name: CVE-2026-22769
objects.description: Vulnerability CVE-2026-22769 referenced in threat report.

objects.content:
Sector: Government, Technology, Healthcare, Manufacturing

Modus operandi:
Exploitation of CVE-2026-22769, creation of 'Ghost NICs' on ESXi for lateral movement, and use of Single Packet Authorization (SPA) via iptables.

objects.name: Notepad++ Supply Chain Compromise
objects.description: A long-term campaign that compromised the hosting provider of Notepad++ to redirect users to malicious updates delivering the Chrysalis backdoor.

objects.content:
Sector: General Users, Developers

Modus operandi:
Compromise of update infrastructure, redirection of requests to malicious XML/binary files.

objects.name: CVE-2026-1281
objects.description:
Unsafe bash script usage allows unauthenticated remote code execution via arithmetic expansion.

Affected product: Endpoint Manager Mobile (EPMM)

Affected vendor: Ivanti

CPE: cpe:2.3:a:ivanti:endpoint_manager_mobile:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

objects.name: CVE-2026-1670
objects.description:
Exposed API endpoint allows unauthenticated users to change the 'forgot password' recovery email address.

Affected product: CCTV Products

Affected vendor: Honeywell

CPE: cpe:2.3:o:honeywell:cctv:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

objects.name: Breach: Figure.com
objects.description:
Data breach involving 967,178 accounts including PII (Names, DOIs, addresses) due to an employee social engineering attack.

Sector: Fintech

objects.name: Breach: Canada Goose
objects.description:
Breach of 581,877 unique accounts. Data includes names, IP addresses, and partial credit card info, originating from a third-party compromise.

Sector: Retail

objects.abstract: Geopolitical analysis (EN) / VPN Regulation and Piracy Control
objects.content:
Sector: Technology, Legal

Theme: VPN Regulation and Piracy Control

A Spanish court ordered NordVPN and ProtonVPN to block piracy sites related to LaLiga, applying EU Digital Services Regulations to VPN infrastructure.

Tags: VPN, Spain, Privacy, Legal

objects.name: Keenadu Android Firmware Backdoor
objects.description:
Sophisticated Android malware embedded in device firmware, compromising Zygote to control all installed applications.

Analysis:
Keenadu represents a persistent threat where malware is pre-installed in the supply chain or via OTA updates. Its deep integration makes standard OS removal impossible.

Recommendations:
- Install clean firmware versions from verified manufacturers.
- Monitor outbound traffic for known malicious C2 domains.

objects.name: AI Services as C2 Proxies
objects.description:
Abuse of AI assistants like Grok and Copilot to act as bidirectional command-and-control relays.

Analysis:
Attackers leverage the web-browsing capabilities of AI assistants to fetch commands and exfiltrate data, blending malicious traffic with legitimate enterprise AI usage.

Recommendations:
- Inspect traffic to AI service providers for high-entropy payloads in query parameters.
- Apply granular egress controls on AI domains.

objects.content: The cyber threat landscape for February 18, 2026, is dominated by sophisticated espionage operations originating from Chinese state-sponsored actors (UNC6201, Lotus Blossom, Silk Typhoon) targeting virtualization infrastructure and supply chains. A major critical zero-day in Dell RecoverPoint (CVSS 10.0) highlights the shift toward 'Ghost NIC' techniques to evade detection in VMware environments. Simultaneously, the emergence of AI-driven Command and Control (C2) proxies using legitimate services like Grok and Copilot signals a new era of adaptive malware. Significant data breaches affecting the fintech (Figure) and luxury (LVMH) sectors underscore the continued efficacy of social engineering and third-party compromises.
